data.title: Distinguish ally and enemy chat messages
data.body: It would be better if the in-game chat showed teammate and enemy messages differently. For example when a teammate says something it could be green underlined and when enemy player posts a message red underline? Or some other way to make them different.

data.title: Make ingame chat links clickable
data.body: When someone pastes a link...

data.title: Facings are broken on imported maps
data.body: 4be5c0338532fba5f6d635ba24825ec9cfb7372b removed `Facing: 0`, except the default facing is 128, not 0. A bunch of medium tanks on the desert shellmap (and other units on other maps) are facing the wrong way because of this.

data.title: MapEditor bug: Some actors place in mapEditor not appearing in-game
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1 - Place tran.husk1 (or any  burnt-out/crashed vehicle actor) in a map.
2 - run map and explore placed actors.

Expected result:
Placed actors are where they were placed.

Actual Result:
Placed actors can not be seen.

Relevant debug log output:
harv.emptyhusk #335 killed by harv.emptyhusk #335
mcv.husk #540 killed by mcv.husk #540
harv.emptyhusk #715 killed by harv.emptyhusk #715
tran.husk2 #1556 killed by tran.husk2 #1556
tran.husk1 #1560 killed by tran.husk1 #1560
tran.husk1 #1561 killed by tran.husk1 #1561

data.title: Converted Missile TurboBoost from boolean to integer percentage
data.body: A small step towards #7509.

data.title: Optimize / help out the most advanced lua maps
data.body:
I really love the advanced lua maps.

Now This(updated) http://resource.openra.net/maps/17486/ is my favorite, but It's so hard to make it work caused by crashes and mostly performance.(it runs sooo slow)
Can you help optimize that and other simmilar maps? Or just give some general tips to the authors?

data.title: Prevent VqaPlayerWidget from eating the radar bin's mouse input
data.body:
This fixes a bug not introduced but exposed by #7156: with the vqa player widget in the player bin, it was not possible anymore to slew the radar's viewport using the mouse, since the widget ate all mouse input.

Fixes #7530 then

data.title: Added uninstaller check for running game
data.body:
The uninstaller now checks if the game or editor is running, fixes #7142.
This requires a new [NSIS plugin(NsProcess)](http://nsis.sourceforge.net/NsProcess_plugin).
I also fixed a dll not getting removed by the uninstaller.

data.title: Missile code needs refactoring
data.body:
It needs at least the following improvements, in my opinion:
- proper 3D math
- ROT should apply to vertical movement as well (maybe as separate VerticalROT)
- customisable launch angle
- support for lazy curve flight behavior (like Bullets with Angle, but with target tracking)
- support for straight flight path instead of the current "move to target's Z height as quickly as possible" behavior
- support for Airburst (as in TS)
- support for voxel artwork

These would be nice to have as well:
- acceleration (instead of constant speed from launch to impact)
- customisable cruise altitude
- customisable explosion altitude (might be better than just Airburst)

data.title: Sell icon not disabled while building is being captured
data.body: When a building is being captured by an enemy, the sell icon on the building is not disabled. It looks like it is possible to sell it but clicking does nothing.

data.title: Fixed all cheat code
data.body: Polished #7505 to activate all cheat codes on call and reset all on call.

data.title: Dog issues
data.body:
I was looking into the dog issues, starting with https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7077.

I implemented a simple algorithm to check wether the dog has a clear line of sight (meaning no obstructions). This worked but introduced another issue, that is ... the pathplanning is not optimal because the dog will run to the wall, stop and needs to reroute. I think that is not really wanted. So maybe we could introduce a new option that some weapons (such as the DogJaw) can only be fired with no obstructions with the target, modify the path planner to keep this in mind and build in a check on the leap to prevent jumping over blocked tiles. 

Any ideas about this? Other approach? There are also some other bugs with the dogs such as https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6798 that may could be resolved by a solid approach.

![screenshot from 2015-02-20 01 27 40](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3428649/6279303/b1f0da9e-b89f-11e4-9ebd-4036927a8bdf.png)

data.title: All cheat on already activated cheats
data.body: Activating the /all cheat code when there is already a cheat activated will activate the rest of the cheats, but will disable the ones already activated. I think all the cheats should be activated when /all is typed and disabled when typed again.

data.title: [Discussion] Red Alert "Flamethrower"
data.body:
recently i was talking to @ScottNZ about the new wave of people (mostly new players) ... using APC-Flamerushes in almost every game ... and that this (soviet) Attack itself is way easier to perform compared to the (allies) defense ... 
it might be possible to defend 1 apc with 5 flamethrowers , but even then it can be really hard , if you dont expect the apc ... (and seriously ... people should have the chance to to setup a quick  defense for every sneaky/easy rush-tactics) 

i do agree that it is a appropriate tactic for a soviet player , and i still want people to use it ... but it should atleast cost some attention and micromanagement for the attacker... not just a click to drive the apc to the location and then a "f"-key hit to watch the enemy struggling to not loose his mcv within the first 5 minutes ... 

@ScottNZ said , we could make the APC slower ... so there is more time to bring the APC down ... 

turrets for example cant reach a apc because he is too fast (there is a exception when the apc drives frontal directly towards the turret , which basicly never happens)

Pillboxes have the problem to get triggered by the APC , but does no damage whatsoever ... instead , the owner of the Pillbox has to wait until the enemy "unloads" the flamethrowers ... and then he has to manually target every enemy .... after every dead target , the pillbox-targeting will jump back to the enemy Apc (depends on the randomness of the "cargo drop" ... ) and you have to pick the next target again ... 

the pillbox-cannon needs for every passenger 2 shots ... (the flamethrower might have less health then a e1 ... but its enough so the pillbox needs still 2 bursts to bring a flamethrower down) 

but its not like my enemy has to put his man in any danger .... the high armor + hp + speed of the apc ... allows easily to avoid defense-structures and just choose a different location and drop the cargo out of defense-range 

a pillbox does 30 damage on infantry ... 
e1 has 50hp 
flamethrower has 40hp 

this has a hudge impact when 5 enemy flamethrowers get unloadet right beside a Construction Yard

so there is definitly more then just a slower apc  ... i have a few ideas 
- flamethrower should not have the same range like a e1 ... (seriously , if we talk about a close-combat unit then we should tweak the range down ... we basicly give flames the same range as a bullet )
- flamethrowers should have the abillity to take out the passengers inside a pillbox , leaving a empty pillbox (or maybe just a chance) 
- similar to the grenadier , there should be a chance for the flamethrower to "explode" ... leaving a 2-3 cell "flame carpet" on the ground for a short time  , which hurts other infantry when stepping over it (or standing inside) ... this chance to explode should preferable depend on the facing-direction of the flamethrower ... and the direction of the bullet

dont get me wrong , i really like the unit ... but currently ... it only does a "shitload" of damage on buildings (grenadiers have the exact same purpose) ... just with a different sprite-sheet 

so im open for new ideas ... or balancing in terms of the flamethrower/apc

data.title: Add Graph for Memory Usage and more Debug Infos
data.body:
Some Games like Minecraft Prints the MemoryUsage from the Process and the Video Memory (vram) onto the Screen. We could implement some points this in our Performance Graph 

This could allow us to see in which moments how many Memory is used and maybe lower the Memory Cosumption
- Driver Information (For example: Nvidia Geforce 550 GTX TI - 1 GB VRAM Nvidia Display Driver Version: 450.52)
- Video Memory (using X MB of <Max VRAM> MB)
- Sys Memory (Using x MB from xxxxMB)
- Ressource Memory (mounted files and loaded content) (Using xx MB from xxxx MB)
- Also how Memory is assigned to OpenRA from the System (assinged 2GB)

This could give as informations for optimazions based on Memory usage

data.title: Reimplementing Left Click Orders with Fixes
data.body:
I know they were removed for being unsupported and right click is realistically superior but gosh darn it, it just can't be C&C to me if this isn't there. I fixed the issues stated in #3153 so that it should function much better. This also adds a deadzone in the selection box as per #4952 with a hardcoded value of 50. This is needed mostly to fix It's probably a bit wider than necessary so it could be changed to another hardcoded value if need be pretty easily, but it probably should be bound to a slider on the options menu.

It's still not perfect, but it's much better than it was previously. At any rate, I don't plan to do too much fiddling with this, so if everyone seems to think major changes are still needed I'll just close the request and forget about it for now. I spent too much time already messing around with something so realistically trivial.

data.title: System.InvalidOperationException: Attempted to get trait from destroyed object
data.body:
I've encountered `System.InvalidOperationException` while playing OpenRA. It seems like the cause is the situation described below.

My ally had a supply truck. And the enemy player had a demo truck. They performed their direct actions at the same time at the same place. That is, the supply truck delivered me cash (to my ore refinery), and the demo truck exploded, probably taking out the ore refinery that was receiving the cash. 

The stacktrace.

```
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20141029
Operating System: Linux (Unix 3.18.6.1)
Runtime Version: Mono 3.12.0 (tarball Thu Jan 15 18:46:56 UTC 2015) CLR 4.0.30319.17020
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Attempted to get trait from destroyed object (truk 1428 (not in world))
  at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.CheckDestroyed (OpenRA.Actor actor) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.GetOrDefault[Mobile] (OpenRA.Actor actor) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Actor.TraitOrDefault[Mobile] () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.RA.LeavesHusk+<Killed>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0 (OpenRA.World w) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.World.Tick () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Loop () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
```

Let me know if you need the demo file for the deeper investigation (it replicates this bug).

I don't know what happened here:
![](http://i.imgur.com/K7QYvlF.png)

The AI built a ranger, I ordered my Mig to attack. (It fired once and missed).
The ranger started moving back and forth like a viceroid and the Mig just kept circling above it. They kept doing that for over 5 minutes.

data.title: Targeting lines under fog
data.body:
I just noticed that if you issue an attack order on an actor that then goes into fog you can actually use the targeting line to track their movement and position.
Pretty sure that would happen with other orders that follow actors and under shroud as well.
I am not saying lose the target when it goes into fog/shroud (although that will be better if done right),
but we probably shouldn't draw target lines if the end point is not visible (although that would have to make an exception for actors with `FrozenUnderFog`). Because this can be exploited.

Following a harvester with my Mig:
![](http://i.imgur.com/HLqSrSc.png)
I could track the harvester's movement as it happened, even though I can't see it.

data.title: add Team Player Colors & U.I form, in OpenRA (for observer and not only)
data.body:
Dear all (specially devs).
After watching some of the SoScared101 match reply casts, I was surprised that I saw a very important and useful feature is missing from the OpenRA engine. Friend or Foe(FoF) coloring support and a small TEAM User Interface form.
Right now its a chaos to understand who is an ally with whom, who is the enemy, who allied maybe during a match with another etc.
5 simple an elegant ideas to solve that, and promote more the OpenRA engine to the multiplayer community allowing easier podcasting of a match, are:

1)have a button for the Observer or the person you views the reply, to change the players selected colors in units, structures, and minimap colors that are the same if they are on the same team! Lets say we have a 2 vs 2 vs 2 match. The 2 players could be blue, the other 2 yellow and the rest green.

2)have the player and the observer to change the color of the selected player to FoF, Green from himself, Yellow for all his allies, and Red for all his Enemies.

3)in addition to the first 2 ideas, just make sure the players name, country-side flag its very clear when the mouse is going over their units, as a tooltip. (as it is right now)

4)Make a small form at the free bottom left corner of the screen accessible from the observer or the player during the game, where you can see always on top of your screen the current player names, side flags, colors, but most important group them by teams, for a fast and easy understanding of the current battle contentions.

5)Make an option Team color Selection into the lobby when creating a game. Allow players to select to be in TEAM 1 (BLUE) TEAM 2 (RED) let them pick a color for their team and their units should be shown as this color when they choose to switch between FoF coloring mode in game.
Any of those, standalone or as a combination or something like that could be used to help us enjoy more the OpenRA games.
Thanks for your time, and I hope you see how helpful and needed is Team Player Colors in OpenRA.

Regards
JohnnyXP64
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/8694533-add-team-player-colors-u-i-form-in-openra-for-observer-and-not-only?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Introduce a render trait for ammo-dependant turret art
data.body:
Needed to (finally) properly use the TD SSM/Mobile SAM turret graphics.

One of the reasons why I started working on #7324, as ammo is probably easier to use than bursts.

data.title: Add OnDiscovered and OnPlayerDiscovered triggers to the Lua API
data.body:
As requested by @Computerfreaked in #7491 - a Lua trigger that is called when an enemy actor becomes visible to the player.
Thanks to @abcdefg30 for the help with testing this.

data.title: Trigger discovered needed
data.body: The original RA game has a trigger that goes off when a unit is discovered by the player. Would be good if we had the same as it is used in single player maps.

data.title: Destroyed ore truck leaves gold behind instead of gems
data.body:
When an ore truck full with gems is destroyed it leaves behind gold instead of gems.

data.title: Ore field change is visible on radar
data.body: If shroud is turned off, it is possible to see the reduction in ore fields on the radar. This allows a player to see where enemy bases are.
